com.googlecode.aluminumproject.converters

Class DefaultConverterRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.converters.DefaultConverterRegistry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurationElement, ConverterRegistry

    public class DefaultConverterRegistry
extends Object
implements ConverterRegistry
    A default converter registry implementation.

    The default converter registry keeps a set of converters, which subclasses are free to add to. Upon initialisation, this set will be filled with all of the converters inside the packages that are listed (separated by commas) in the configuration parameter "converter_registry.default.converter.packages", or, when no such parameter is added, with all of the converters in the com.googlecode.aluminumproject.converters package (and subpackages). The converter package list is extended by the packages that are contained in the configuration parameter named "configuration.default.configuration_element.packages".

    When a default converter registry is asked to get a converter, it will try to find the most specific one. This means that when a converter for a string is requested and the registry contains converters for both strings and objects, the converter that converts strings will be returned, even though both would be able to convert values of the requested type.
